docs.snippet: Five days after details about Cambridge Analytica’s data mining were made public, Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook’s chief executive, spoke with The New York Times.

headline.main: Listen to ‘The Daily’: Can Facebook Be Fixed?

docs.snippet: As the social network grapples with the way it handles consumer data, it has unveiled a centralized page for people to control their privacy and security settings.

headline.print_headline: Facebook, Stung by Data Harvest, Says It Will Centralize Its Privacy Settings
headline.main: Facebook Introduces Central Page for Privacy and Security Settings

docs.snippet: They exploit our data and make us unhappy. They spread misinformation and undermine democracy. Is salvation possible for social networks?

headline.print_headline: Its Ideals Tainted, Can Social Media Shine Again?

docs.snippet: Allowing advertisers to limit who sees ads based on interests or demographics violates federal laws, the groups behind the lawsuit argue.

headline.print_headline: Housing Ads Allow Bias, Facebook Is Told in Suit
headline.main: Facebook Vowed to End Discriminatory Housing Ads. Suit Says It Didn’t.

docs.snippet: Patrons of the social network are deleting their profiles in protest over reports that the company allowed a political data firm to harvest private information.

headline.print_headline: Desertions In Wake Of Missteps By Facebook
headline.main: For Many Facebook Users, a ‘Last Straw’ That Led Them to Quit

docs.snippet: The social network was said to have reached a deal with the executive to depart after disagreements over how to address its role in spreading disinformation.

headline.print_headline: Security Officer To Exit Facebook As Outcry Grows
headline.main: Facebook Exit Hints at Dissent on Handling of Russian Trolls

docs.snippet: The social media network’s privacy practices are being investigated by the Federal Trade Commission.
Cambridge Analytica was aided by an employee at Palantir, a contractor to the Pentagon. Palantir is owned by Peter Thiel, a wealthy Trump supporter and board member at Facebook.

headline.print_headline: Spy Contractor’s Idea Helped A Firm Harvest Facebook Data
headline.main: Spy Contractor’s Idea Helped Cambridge Analytica Harvest Facebook Data

docs.snippet: The political action committee founded by John Bolton hired Cambridge Analytica specifically to develop psychological profiles of voters — and it knew the firm was using Facebook data.

headline.print_headline: Bolton’s PAC Reaped Harvest of Facebook Data to Target Voters
headline.main: Bolton Was Early Beneficiary of Cambridge Analytica’s Facebook Data

docs.snippet: Brian Acton, one of the creators of WhatsApp, sold his company to the internet giant for $19 billion. Now he’s telling people to “#deletefacebook.”

headline.print_headline: Silicon Valley Critics Include Entrepreneur Facebook Made Rich
headline.main: Facebook Made Him a Billionaire. Now He’s a Critic.
